meanings.definition: Full of or characterized by anger
meanings.sent1: She gave an irefully glare to her brother for breaking her toy.
meanings.sent2: The irefully boss scolded the employees for their mistakes.
meanings.sent3: The irefully cat knocked over the vase in protest of being ignored.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered in an irefully manner, ready to unleash their fury.
meanings.sent5: His irefully expression made everyone in the room uneasy.

meanings.definition: In an angry or resentful manner
meanings.sent1: He spoke irefully about the unfair treatment he received.
meanings.sent2: She stared irefully at the person who had wronged her.
meanings.sent3: The child stomped irefully after being told it was bedtime.
meanings.sent4: The engine roared irefully as the car struggled up the steep hill.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's voice rose irefully as she scolded the misbehaving students.
